description.value:
Wise recluses, honed athletes, or the magically awakened. Monks are able to harness magic in the air around them to perform fantastical attacks, move with lightning speed, and strike with powerful martial arts.

The following is a revision of the 5e monk class, meant to increase @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.aaftAEUfyNoAbFS3]{unarmed damage}, move monk resources off its short rest recovery system, and prevent stunning strike spamming at high levels. There are also more useful abilities at higher levels. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the monk class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#monk]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Monks

When you create a level 1 Monk, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 8   &reference[Dexterity]:16   &reference[Constitution]: 14   &reference[Intelligence]: 10   &reference[Wisdom]: 16   &reference[Charisma]: 10 

or

Strength: 8   Dexterity:16   Constitution: 14   Intelligence: 12  Wisdom: 14   Charisma: 12  

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per monk level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: None
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{Scimitars}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{Shortswords}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: Choose one type of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#artists-tools]{artisan's tools} or one @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#musical-instrument]{musical instrument}
Saving Throws: &reference[Strength], &Reference[Dexterity]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &reference[Acrobatics], &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[History], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Religion], and &Reference[Stealth]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{scimitar} -OR- a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{shortsword} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
  • 10 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.NwVBTiWfOh1XmGIm]{darts}
  • two sets of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#artists-tools]{Artist's Tools}, which you gained proficiency with as part of the monk class
  • a dungeoneer's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a monk level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level monks gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For monks you must have:

  • Either Strength: 14 or Dexterity: 14

  • Wisdom: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per monk level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{Scimitars}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{Shortswords}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: Choose one type of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#artists-tools]{artisan's tools} or one @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#musical-instrument]{musical instrument}

advancement.title: Flurry of Blows Improvement
advancement.hint: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can now make two unarmed strikes instead of one.​

advancement.title: Diamond Soul
advancement.hint: Your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws except death saving throws.

advancement.title: Purity of Body
advancement.hint: You are immune to disease and poison, including poison damage and the Poisoned condition.

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a scimitar -OR- a shortsword -OR- any Simple Weapon

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose the tools you gained proficiency with.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats, monk feats, and combat maneuver feats by default.
                        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                        
                        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Fighting Style
advancement.hint:
Monks interact with Single Weapon Fighting and Two-Weapon Fighting in unusual ways.

Single Weapon Fighting: Unarmed attacks count as weapon attacks, so you can only use this style when you do not make off-hand unarmed attacks on the same turn.

Two-Weapon Fighting: As a monk, you can make off-hand attacks without penalty with unarmed strikes, so only choose this style if you want to dual-wield weapons.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

advancement.title: Monastic Tradition
advancement.hint:
You commit yourself to a monastic tradition. Your choice of monastic tradition represents a school of thought that your monk follows to harness ki. Your tradition grants you features at this level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level, also listed below.
                
                Monastic Traditions published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the monk class. However, due to balance changes to the monk, any subclass feature that allows you to make two attacks as a bonus action should instead only allow you to make one attack as a bonus action. This is because we redesigned the monk to get an additional attack without using their bonus action.

For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
